note: Initial foundation catalog with scorecard assessments for all 9 critical areas. All recommendations meet minimum score threshold of 0.6.

candidates_evaluated.name: Keycloak
candidates_evaluated.strengths: Red Hat backed, huge community, proven at enterprise scale, excellent OIDC/OAuth2 support
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: Resource-heavy, some CVEs in 2024 (CVE-2024-3656, CVE-2024-8698) but rapidly patched

candidates_evaluated.name: Zitadel
candidates_evaluated.strengths: Modern Go-based, excellent performance, good developer experience
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: Smaller team, less proven at scale, newer project

candidates_evaluated.name: Authentik
candidates_evaluated.strengths: Python-based, modern UI, good feature set
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: Smaller community, less enterprise adoption

cve_monitoring.remediation_plan: Use Keycloak 26.0.7 or later. Monitor Red Hat security advisories. Enable automated Dependabot updates.

succession_plan.trigger_conditions: If 2+ critical CVEs unpatched >90 days OR Red Hat discontinues support OR major breaking changes without migration path

foundations.notes: Industry standard for enterprise SSO. Multi-tenant support excellent. Admin UI comprehensive. GDPR-compliant with EU deployment options. Integrates well with Next.js + FastAPI via OIDC libraries.

candidates_evaluated.name: OPA (Open Policy Agent)
candidates_evaluated.strengths: CNCF graduated, battle-tested, excellent for complex policies, huge ecosystem
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: Rego learning curve, slightly slower than OpenFGA for relational checks

candidates_evaluated.name: OpenFGA
candidates_evaluated.strengths: Zanzibar-inspired, <10ms p95 performance, great for relationship-based auth
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: Recent CVEs (CVE-2025-25196, CVE-2025-46331), less mature than OPA

candidates_evaluated.name: Casbin
candidates_evaluated.strengths: Multi-language support, good performance
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: Smaller community, less enterprise adoption

known_issues: CVE-2024-8260 (CVSS 6.7) - SMB force-auth on Windows - Fixed in v0.68.0
cve_monitoring.remediation_plan: Use OPA v0.70.0+. Avoid Windows deployments if possible. Monitor CNCF security advisories.

succession_plan.trigger_conditions: If CNCF drops support OR performance degrades >50ms p95 OR major unfixed security issues

foundations.notes: Best for complex policy-as-code scenarios. RBAC + ABAC hybrid support. Rego is powerful but requires learning. REST API easy to integrate from both TS and Python. CNCF graduated = long-term viability. Consider OpenFGA for pure relationship-based authorization if Rego is blocker.

candidates_evaluated.name: Postgres + Prisma + SQLModel
candidates_evaluated.strengths: Type-safe for both TS/Python, excellent RLS support, mature migration tools, huge community
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: Prisma can be heavyweight, SQLModel less mature than SQLAlchemy

candidates_evaluated.name: Postgres + Drizzle + SQLAlchemy
candidates_evaluated.strengths: Drizzle lighter than Prisma, SQLAlchemy very mature
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: Drizzle newer with smaller ecosystem

known_issues: Prisma: GHSA-pxcc-hj8w-fmm7 (command injection in SDK) - Fixed in latest
Operator injection risks - mitigated by input validation
cve_monitoring.remediation_plan: Use Prisma 6.1.0+. Implement strict input validation with Zod/Joi. Never pass raw user input to where clauses. Enable RLS at DB level as defense-in-depth.

succession_plan.trigger_conditions: If Prisma discontinues open-source OR major unpatched security issues OR performance regression >2x

foundations.notes: Perfect fit for Next.js + FastAPI stack. Prisma's type generation is gold standard for TS. SQLModel gives FastAPI same developer experience. PostgreSQL RLS critical for multi-tenant isolation. Use schema-per-tenant for high isolation or shared-schema+RLS for efficiency. Connection pooling via PgBouncer or Prisma Accelerate. EU hosting via AWS RDS (Frankfurt), GCP CloudSQL (Belgium), or self-hosted.

candidates_evaluated.name: Temporal
candidates_evaluated.strengths: Best-in-class workflow orchestration, durable execution, TS + Python SDKs, enterprise-ready
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: Heavier than simple queues, requires server deployment, some dependency CVEs

candidates_evaluated.name: BullMQ
candidates_evaluated.strengths: Redis-based, very fast, TS-native, simpler than Temporal
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: Node.js only (Python via Redis), less durable than Temporal workflows

candidates_evaluated.name: Celery
candidates_evaluated.strengths: Python standard, mature
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: Python-only, development slowed, awkward TS integration

known_issues: Dependency CVEs in Docker images (golang.org/x/net, JWT) - Monitor releases
cve_monitoring.remediation_plan: Use Temporal 1.25.2+. Subscribe to Temporal Trust Portal. Run server on isolated network. Use mTLS for production.

succession_plan.trigger_conditions: If license changes OR major unpatched security issues OR vendor lock-in concerns with Temporal Cloud

foundations.notes: Overkill for simple queues but perfect for complex workflows (multi-step onboarding, payment flows, data pipelines). Durable execution = workflows survive crashes. TS + Python SDKs allow cross-language workflows. Multi-tenant isolation via namespaces. Self-hosted or Temporal Cloud. Consider BullMQ for simple background jobs, Temporal for mission-critical workflows.

candidates_evaluated.name: FastAPI
candidates_evaluated.strengths: Python standard for modern APIs, OpenAPI auto-gen, async, Pydantic integration, huge community
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: CVE-2024-24762 (ReDoS) fixed in 0.109.1+

candidates_evaluated.name: NestJS
candidates_evaluated.strengths: TS-native, enterprise patterns, good for large teams
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: More boilerplate than FastAPI, Node.js ecosystem

known_issues: CVE-2024-24762 (CVSS 7.5) - ReDoS in Content-Type parsing - FIXED in 0.109.1+
CVE-2024-47874 (Starlette dependency, CVSS 8.7) - Fixed in Starlette 0.40.0
cve_monitoring.remediation_plan: Use FastAPI 0.115.6+ (includes Starlette 0.40.0+). Monitor python-multipart updates. Implement request size limits and timeouts.

succession_plan.trigger_conditions: If maintainer abandons OR major unpatched CVEs OR ecosystem shift away from Python

foundations.notes: Perfect for AI-powered platform - Python = AI/ML ecosystem access. Type-safe via Pydantic. OpenAPI auto-generation critical for connector SDK. Async support for high concurrency. Middleware for auth (OIDC), logging, tracing. Integrates seamlessly with SQLModel, Temporal Python SDK, OPA. Deploy via Uvicorn/Gunicorn. EU hosting: AWS Lambda (Frankfurt), Google Cloud Run (Belgium), or self-hosted K8s.

candidates_evaluated.name: Radix UI + shadcn/ui
candidates_evaluated.strengths: Headless + styled, accessibility-first, perfect Next.js fit, Tailwind integration, copy-paste components
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: Radix receiving fewer updates (mature, not abandoned), shadcn is wrapper not library

candidates_evaluated.name: Mantine
candidates_evaluated.strengths: Batteries-included, good DX
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: More opinionated styling, heavier bundle

known_issues: No direct CVEs in Radix UI
shadcn dependency lodash CVE-2021-23337 (command injection) - addressed in newer versions
cve_monitoring.remediation_plan: Use latest Radix UI (1.1.4+) and shadcn/ui. Monitor npm audit. Implement CSP headers for XSS protection.

succession_plan.trigger_conditions: If Radix is abandoned (unlikely - used by millions) OR major accessibility regressions OR licensing changes

foundations.notes: Best choice for accessibility (WCAG 2.1 AA) and customization. Radix provides unstyled primitives (modals, dropdowns, etc.) with keyboard nav and screen reader support. shadcn/ui adds beautiful Tailwind styles as copy-paste code (not npm package = full control). Perfect for Next.js + Tailwind stack. Figma tokens support via Design Tokens plugin. Storybook integration straightforward. EU-first: no external CDN dependencies, self-hosted fonts.

candidates_evaluated.name: Pulumi
candidates_evaluated.strengths: TS/Python native (no DSL), multi-cloud, better license than Terraform (Apache 2.0 vs BSL)
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: Smaller ecosystem than Terraform, some dependency CVEs

candidates_evaluated.name: Terraform
candidates_evaluated.strengths: Industry standard, huge provider ecosystem
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: BSL 1.1 license (NOT OSI-approved), HashiCorp commercial restrictions, HCL learning curve

candidates_evaluated.name: ArgoCD
candidates_evaluated.strengths: CNCF graduated, best-in-class GitOps for K8s
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: K8s-specific (not general IaC)

known_issues: Pulumi CVE-2024-24791 (Go net/http DoS) - Fixed in Go 1.22.5+
cve_monitoring.remediation_plan: Use Pulumi 3.176.0+, ArgoCD 2.13.3+. Store state in encrypted S3/GCS. Use OIDC for cloud auth (no long-lived keys). Implement GitOps workflows.

succession_plan.trigger_conditions: If Pulumi changes license OR major security issues OR vendor lock-in with Pulumi Cloud

foundations.notes: Pulumi > Terraform due to: (1) Apache 2.0 vs BSL 1.1 license, (2) TS/Python = same languages as app code, (3) better type-safety. Use Pulumi for IaC (AWS/GCP/Azure resources). Use ArgoCD for K8s deployments (GitOps). Secret management: AWS Secrets Manager / GCP Secret Manager + External Secrets Operator. Cost estimation: Infracost (works with Pulumi). EU hosting: Deploy control plane in EU region.

foundations.chosen_component: Playwright (E2E) + Vitest (TS unit) + pytest (Python unit) + Pact (Contract)

candidates_evaluated.name: Playwright
candidates_evaluated.strengths: Multi-browser, Microsoft-backed, excellent DX, fast parallel execution
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: Browser bundle CVEs (not core library), heavier than Cypress

candidates_evaluated.name: Vitest + pytest
candidates_evaluated.strengths: Native to Vite/FastAPI ecosystems, very fast, great DX
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: Vitest newer than Jest (but actively maintained)

candidates_evaluated.name: Pact
candidates_evaluated.strengths: Contract testing standard, multi-language
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: Learning curve, requires broker setup

known_issues: Playwright: Browser bundle CVEs (Chrome/Chromium) - update browsers regularly
No core library CVEs in Playwright, Vitest, or pytest
cve_monitoring.remediation_plan: Update Playwright browsers weekly. Pin Playwright version in CI. Use headless mode in production. Implement test isolation.

succession_plan.trigger_conditions: If Microsoft abandons Playwright OR major unpatched CVEs OR performance degradation

foundations.notes: Multi-layer testing strategy: (1) Unit tests: Vitest for TS (Next.js, UI), pytest for Python (FastAPI, workflows). (2) Integration tests: API tests with Playwright or Supertest. (3) E2E tests: Playwright for critical user journeys. (4) Contract tests: Pact for API contracts between Next.js and FastAPI. (5) Performance: k6 or Artillery for load testing. Coverage: aim for 80%+ on critical paths. CI: GitHub Actions with matrix builds. Accessibility: Playwright + axe-core.

candidates_evaluated.name: Trivy
candidates_evaluated.strengths: All-in-one scanner (CVE, license, secret, SBOM, IaC), Aqua Security backing, very fast, excellent CI integration
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: Some dependency CVEs (golang.org/x packages) but actively patched

candidates_evaluated.name: Syft + Grype
candidates_evaluated.strengths: Anchore backing, excellent SBOM generation
candidates_evaluated.weaknesses: Two tools vs one, smaller community than Trivy

cve_monitoring.remediation_plan: Use Trivy 0.58.2+. Run in CI on every PR. Fail builds on critical CVEs. Generate SBOM (CycloneDX/SPDX) for compliance.

succession_plan.trigger_conditions: If Aqua abandons open-source OR major unpatched security issues in Trivy itself OR licensing changes

foundations.notes: Trivy is comprehensive: (1) Container scanning: Docker images for CVEs. (2) SBOM generation: CycloneDX/SPDX for supply chain visibility. (3) License scanning: GDPR compliance check. (4) Secret scanning: prevent hardcoded API keys. (5) IaC scanning: Terraform/Pulumi misconfigurations. (6) Filesystem scanning: source code dependencies. Integration: GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, pre-commit hooks. Complement with: Sigstore (cosign) for artifact signing, TruffleHog for additional secret detection, Dependabot/Renovate for automated updates. GDPR: SBOM documents all data processing components.

summary.evaluation_methodology: FSA adoption scorecard with weighted dimensions: security (30%), stability (25%), performance (15%), integration_fit (15%), license (10%), community (5%). All candidates scored >=0.6 minimum threshold.
constraints_applied: EU-first: All choices support EU hosting and GDPR compliance
OSI-approved licenses: All choices use MIT, Apache 2.0, or PostgreSQL License
No vendor lock-in: All open-source with self-hosting options
Next.js + FastAPI stack compatibility: All integrate seamlessly
